Sentencas: Solid oxide cells (SOCs) including solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) and solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs) are advanced electrochemical energy storage and conversion devices.
Titulo: Efficient bifunctional electrocatalysts for solid oxide cells based on the structural evolution of perovskites with abundant defects and exsolved CoFe nanoparticles

Sentencas: However, the lack of highly active and stable fuel electrode materials impedes their practical applications.
Titulo: Efficient bifunctional electrocatalysts for solid oxide cells based on the structural evolution of perovskites with abundant defects and exsolved CoFe nanoparticles

Sentencas: Herein, in-situ exsolved CoFe nanoparticles on perovskite matrixes with abundant defects are developed as bifunctional fuel electrocatalysts for SOCs from the Sr(2)FeMo(1-x)CoxO(6-delta) (x = 0, 0.15, 0.25, 0.45) precursor.
Titulo: Efficient bifunctional electrocatalysts for solid oxide cells based on the structural evolution of perovskites with abundant defects and exsolved CoFe nanoparticles

Sentencas: Increasement of Co doping promotes CoFe alloy exsolution and the formation of more defects in the remaining perovskite matrix under reducing atmosphere at high temperatures.
Titulo: Efficient bifunctional electrocatalysts for solid oxide cells based on the structural evolution of perovskites with abundant defects and exsolved CoFe nanoparticles

Sentencas: Consequently, with increasing Co dopant content, the electrocatalytic activity towards CO2 electrolysis and hydrogen (H-2) fuel oxidation are both significantly enhanced for the reduced Sr2FeMo1-xCoxO6-delta.
Titulo: Efficient bifunctional electrocatalysts for solid oxide cells based on the structural evolution of perovskites with abundant defects and exsolved CoFe nanoparticles

Sentencas: The reduced Sr2FeMo1-xCoxO6-delta with high Co doping content of x = 0.45 electrocatalysts also exhibits respectable coking resistance and excellent long-term stability.
Titulo: Efficient bifunctional electrocatalysts for solid oxide cells based on the structural evolution of perovskites with abundant defects and exsolved CoFe nanoparticles

Sentencas: The high performance may be owing to the unique simultaneously in-situ formed nanoalloy-oxide heterostructure and electron-ion mixed conductive perovskite matrixes with abundant defects.
Titulo: Efficient bifunctional electrocatalysts for solid oxide cells based on the structural evolution of perovskites with abundant defects and exsolved CoFe nanoparticles
